result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen H Desrosiers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business Monday. 
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment. 
Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations. 
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.
The Def is to obtain assessments/counseling/programming as directed by DOC.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

timeConds.notes: Granted Huber under the terms set by the Sheriff.
to be approved by the DOC.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

1:00 PM Defendant Stephen H Desrosiers appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer appeared by video for Stephen H Desrosiers.  Attorney Ruth Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Parties have an agreement.  Def waives right to personal appearance.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Atty def admits that he is a repeater.  Atty, def pleads NO CONTEST, def agrees.  File contains a PLQ, def understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts NO CONTEST plea.  As a factual basis can court rely on the information in the complaint, parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists and finds def GUILTY and direct judgment enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  See attached for sentencing.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Oct 14;  ka
